instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message:
Hey , 

Working on 820 3437, initial the board start, fans spins only after 30-50 sec but don't have any chime!   first impression the board is very clean but with a real inspection i noticed <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> have a bit off humidity! pins 23-24 because off the corrosion don't do the contact component-Board! i take the <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> reconstruct the trace and ressolder the component <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>. After this the board don't start anymore !! already replace <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> for new on and same history, no fan!! 

i already double inspect and don't found more humidity !!! 

ppbus, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> , <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> - ALL OK  

 <SIGNAL>MC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>. - ALL OK 

only don't have <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> !! 

any idea???

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> controls only <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>, not <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is generated by <CHIP>U8080</CHIP>, controlled by <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3</SIGNAL>, via <CHIP>U8180</CHIP>.

Do you miss more voltages?

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message: You right, missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>! have 0V on this point!! i pull this line when i measuring the board!

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message: On this line is pulsing 0v - 1.6 , 0V - 4V....

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message:
Other coils pulsing?
Is always better to use o-scope, to check pulses...
Normal DC multimeter will not catch the peak value.

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message: yes, L7320, L7310,L7630, L7430 pulsing too!!

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message: What about <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, pins 7 & 3?

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message: Ya, all pin's are pulsing!! <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> problem??

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message: but this area looks well!! don't have corrosion !!

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message:
"all pin's are pulsing"
Do you mean pin8 pulsing too?
There is <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, should be stable...

Check now all the SPI termination resistors.
Also check traces around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, try new BIOS...

Inspect carefully the area where you worked first time, around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.
Maybe some resistor/trace affected close to it.

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message: i means pin 7 & 3. Pin 8 3.4V stable! ok, 2informaticos i will check!! thank you for your's reply

threads.title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
threads.message: You hit full, Bios problem! i replace a bios for another donor board and the machine comes to life!! but, now i need a BIOS! i will update a original bios here!
